name: Clicked Phishing Link
description: You clicked on a suspicious link and may have been exposed to phishing

steps.title: Disconnect from network immediately
steps.detail: Prevent malware from communicating with command servers or spreading to other devices

steps.title: Do NOT enter any credentials
steps.detail: If you haven't entered passwords/payment info yet, don't do it now

steps.title: Change passwords on a different device
steps.detail: Change passwords for any accounts that might have been compromised. Use a clean device

steps.title: Run full antivirus scan
steps.detail: Scan for malware that may have been downloaded when you clicked the link

steps.title: Check recent account activity
steps.detail: Look for unauthorized logins, transactions, or changes to your accounts

steps.title: Enable two-factor authentication
steps.detail: Add extra security layer to prevent unauthorized access

steps.title: Report the phishing attempt
steps.detail: Forward the phishing email to your email provider and relevant authorities

steps.title: Monitor accounts for 30 days
steps.detail: Watch for any suspicious activity in the coming weeks

name: Ransomware Attack
description: Your files have been encrypted and a ransom is demanded

steps.title: Isolate infected system IMMEDIATELY
steps.detail: Disconnect from network and turn off WiFi/Bluetooth to prevent spread

steps.title: Do NOT pay the ransom
steps.detail: Paying doesn't guarantee file recovery and funds criminal operations

steps.title: Document everything
steps.detail: Take photos of ransom note, affected files, error messages. This is evidence

steps.title: Contact law enforcement
steps.detail: Report to FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center (ic3.gov) or local authorities

steps.title: Identify the ransomware variant
steps.detail: Use ID Ransomware or similar tools to identify strain (may have free decryption)

steps.title: Check for backups
steps.detail: Look for recent backups on external drives or cloud storage

steps.title: Restore from clean backup
steps.detail: If backups exist, wipe infected system and restore from known-good backup

steps.title: Scan all systems
steps.detail: Run antivirus on all connected devices to ensure ransomware hasn't spread

name: Malware Infection
description: Your system is infected with malicious software

steps.title: Disconnect from internet
steps.detail: Stop malware from downloading additional payloads or communicating with attackers

steps.title: Boot into Safe Mode
steps.detail: Restart in Safe Mode to prevent most malware from running

steps.title: Run malware removal tools
steps.detail: Use reputable antivirus/anti-malware software to scan and remove threats

steps.title: Delete temporary files
steps.detail: Clear temp files, cache, and downloads where malware often hides

steps.title: Change all passwords
steps.detail: Malware may have captured credentials. Change passwords on a clean device

steps.title: Check browser extensions
steps.detail: Remove any unfamiliar or suspicious browser extensions

steps.title: Monitor for 7 days
steps.detail: Watch for unusual behavior to ensure complete removal

name: Data Breach / Account Compromised
description: Your personal data or account has been compromised

steps.title: Change password immediately
steps.detail: Use a strong, unique password you haven't used elsewhere

steps.title: Enable two-factor authentication
steps.detail: Add extra security layer to the compromised account

steps.title: Check for unauthorized activity
steps.detail: Review login history, transactions, and account changes

steps.title: Revoke access to third-party apps
steps.detail: Remove connections to apps that may have been compromised

steps.title: Alert contacts if needed
steps.detail: If your email/social media was breached, warn contacts about potential scam messages

steps.title: Monitor credit reports
steps.detail: If financial data was exposed, check credit reports for fraud

steps.title: Change passwords on related accounts
steps.detail: If you reused passwords, change them on all other accounts
